titleStmt.title: John Goodryche, clerk versus Thomas Apowen, gentleman, and Katherine, his wife, executrix, and late the wife of William Woseley. 1533 - 1538

abstract.p: A bill of complaint by John Goodryche, clerk, against Thomas Apowen, gentleman, and Katherine, his wife, executrix, and late the wife of William Woseley.

div.p:
Too the ryght honorable Syr Thomas Audley knyght
lorde Chauncelor off Inglonde

In hys moste humble wyse Shewythe &and Complaynythe unto yor Good lordshyp yor pour &and Dayly orator John Goodryche Clarke Executor off the Tastament &and laste wyll off Robert Thorne
off Bristoll marchaunte Decessyde that wher the seyde Robart Thorne was in hys lyff possessed off dyvers Goodes &and Cattalles the Certente &and value wheroff ... sayde
orator unknowen And he beynge theroff so possessyd ... hole mynde & and ... remembrance made hys laste will &and Testamement &and by hys sayde laste wylle &and Testament ordenyde
&and declarede that the Chyldren off oon William Woseley sholde have Certen Goodes &and off the same ordeynede &and made yor sayde orator William Woseley &and John Wyett hys coexecutors
&and diede after whose dethe Certen bokes plate specialtes &and other Goodes off the sayde Robart Thorne came unto thehandes &and possession off the seyde William Woseley one of the
seyde executors the Certante wheroff &and also the value ys to yor sayde orator unknowne and soo beynge possessyde off the same as one off the same Coexecutors off the Seyde Robert ...
Bristoll afterwarde made &and ordeynede hys laste will &and Testament &and by the same ordeyned &and made Katheryn hys wyff hys executrice &and died after whose dethe the seyde bokes plate Specialties &and other
Goodes off the seyde Robart Thorne came into the handes &and possession off the sayde Catheryn and the Ryght of the same goodes &and Catalles too yor seyde orator &and to the fforsayde John Wyett
hys Coexecutor by the dethe off the seyde William Woseley ... ... by reson off Syirvivors &and after the fforsayde Catheryn Toke to her husbonde att Bristoll afforesayde one Thomas Apowen
Gentleman &and ther Espouselles betwene them wher solemnized ... ... after the Seyde John Wyett dyede after whose dethe thereyght off the fforseyde Goodes &and Catalles to yor seyde orator
&and they &and every off them to delyver the sayde bokes bylles goodes &and Catalles ... ... ... hathe refused to make delyvere &and yett dothe Contrarye too all lawe &and consiens all ?veyc[acion] yorr seyde orator ys
nowe in sute in dyvers Espirituall Cortes by the chyldran off the sayde William Woyseley &and others ffor Certen legaces to them made by the sayde Robart Thorne the Testator off ?parcell off the
sayde Goodes &and Cattalles whereby the wyll &and Intente off the sayde Robert Thorne maye nott ne Cannott be performede &and yor sayde orator vexed &and sued ffor the same in the sayde spirituall Courtes yor sayd
orator havynge noo Remedie by the order off the Comen lawe too obtayne the same for the Causes above rehersede In Consideracion wherof ytt maye therffore please yor good lordshipp
the premysses Tendarly Consyderyde fforasmoche as yor seyde orator knowathe nott the Certente or parcelles off the sayde goodes Cattalles bylles &and specialties ne what ye Conteynede in the
seyde bylles or bokes to graunte the kynges most gracius wrytte off Subpena to be dyrected unto the seyde Thomas Apowan &and Kateryn hys wyff Comanndynge them &and every off then
by the same att a Certen daye &and apon a payne Certen by yor lordshypp too be ?lerneyde in the same ?wrete personally to Appere beffore yor lordshypp in the kynges moste honorable
Courte off the Chauncery then &and ther to make aunswere unto the premisses &and to all other matters wyche then &and thar ?shalbe obiectyde &and aleggyde ayainste hym &and you &and yor
sayde orator shall dayly pray ffor the ?p(ro)fparne ... off yor honorable lordship long to ...
